page.title: 03AGRICULTURE
page.content: The main crops surrounding Billingborough and Horbling are wheat, barley and oil seed rape. The minor crops are sugar beet and vegetables. A small amount of grass is grown for hay and an even smaller amount for grazing. Many of the crops are grown for seed. There are two seed merchants in Billingborough who collect wheat and barley seed locally and export it through Boston docks. Stubble burning has become a major cause of contention between the farmers and other residents of the area although there is now a move to reduce burning and much stricter controls have been introduced. Motorists also object strongly to the amount of mud left on the roads by tractors coming off the fields.
